intro: Maytenus jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican mayten, is a small evergreen tree native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
